result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:47 AM Defendant Robert C Ward in court, in custody, with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim A appeared in person.

The Defense stated they were ready for a prelim.
The Defendant now wishes to waive his prelim hearing.

The Court recesses at 09:49 AM for Defense to go over the prelim waiver form.
The Court recalls the matter at 09:51 AM with the same appearances.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.

Victim A stated that she was not given the Zoom ID from victim/witness since she is not working with them anymore.
The Court requests the State to talk with Victim A or should she want the Zoom ID she can call the Criminal/Traffic Clerk's Office to get the Zoom ID.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CONDITIONS:
Defendant to have no contact with Victim A (including her children) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. 
Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 
Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.
Defendant is not to come within 5.0 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.
Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. 
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

03:15 PM Defendant Robert C Ward in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.   Kristi J Gordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared by Zoom with victim/witness specialist Kari Blankenheim who appeared by Zoom.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court goes over the procedural history fo the case.
The Court quashes the warrant.
The Court questions why the other parent of Victim A's children is not notified under Marsy's Law.
ADA Gordon replies. 
The Court requests the State to look further into the matter.

The Court address the WCS non compliance.
Attorney Rypel presents statements. 
Victim A presents statements.
ADA Gordon presents statements and requests cash bail.
Attorney Rypel presents counter statements.
The Court places its findings on the record for the parties.
The Court sets cash bail.
